Cols.Name: time_
Cols.Desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

Cols.Name: upid
Cols.Desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

Cols.Name: remote_addr
Cols.Desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

Cols.Name: remote_port
Cols.Desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

Cols.Name: trace_role
Cols.Desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

Cols.Name: major_version
Cols.Desc: HTTP major version, can be 1 or 2

Cols.Name: minor_version
Cols.Desc: HTTP minor version, HTTP1 uses 1, HTTP2 set this value to 0

Cols.Name: content_type
Cols.Desc: Type of the HTTP payload, can be JSON or protobuf

Cols.Name: req_headers
Cols.Desc: Request headers in JSON format

Cols.Name: req_method
Cols.Desc: HTTP request method (e.g. GET, POST, ...)

Cols.Name: req_path
Cols.Desc: Request path

Cols.Name: req_body
Cols.Desc: Request body in JSON format

Cols.Name: req_body_size
Cols.Desc: Request body size (before any truncation)

Cols.Name: resp_headers
Cols.Desc: Response headers in JSON format

Cols.Name: resp_status
Cols.Desc: HTTP response status code

Cols.Name: resp_message
Cols.Desc: HTTP response status text (e.g. OK, Not Found, ...)

Cols.Name: resp_body
Cols.Desc: Response body in JSON format

Cols.Name: resp_body_size
Cols.Desc: Response body size (before any truncation)

Cols.Name: latency
Cols.Desc: Request-response latency.

datatablesDocs.Name: conn_stats
datatablesDocs.Desc: Connection-level stats. This table contains statistics on the communications made between client-server pairs. For network-level information such as RX/TX errors and drops, see the Network-Layer Stats (network_stats) table.

Cols.Name: time_
Cols.Desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

Cols.Name: upid
Cols.Desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

Cols.Name: remote_addr
Cols.Desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

Cols.Name: remote_port
Cols.Desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

Cols.Name: trace_role
Cols.Desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

Cols.Name: addr_family
Cols.Desc: The socket address family of the connection.

Cols.Name: protocol
Cols.Desc: The protocol of the traffic on the connections.

Cols.Name: ssl
Cols.Desc: Was SSL traffic detected on this connection.

Cols.Name: conn_open
Cols.Desc: The number of connections opened since the beginning of tracing.

Cols.Name: conn_close
Cols.Desc: The number of connections closed since the beginning of tracing.

Cols.Name: conn_active
Cols.Desc: The number of active connections

Cols.Name: bytes_sent
Cols.Desc: The number of bytes sent to the remote endpoint(s).

Cols.Name: bytes_recv
Cols.Desc: The number of bytes received from the remote endpoint(s).

Cols.Name: time_
Cols.Desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

Cols.Desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

Cols.Name: remote_addr

Cols.Name: remote_port

Cols.Name: trace_role

Cols.Desc: Request-response latency.

datatablesDocs.Name: process_stats
datatablesDocs.Desc: CPU, memory and IO stats for all K8s processes in your cluster.

Cols.Name: time_
Cols.Desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

Cols.Name: upid
Cols.Desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

Cols.Name: major_faults
Cols.Desc: Number of major page faults

Cols.Name: minor_faults
Cols.Desc: Number of minor page faults

Cols.Name: cpu_utime_ns
Cols.Desc: Time spent on user space by the process

Cols.Name: cpu_ktime_ns
Cols.Desc: Time spent on kernel by the process

Cols.Name: num_threads
Cols.Desc: Number of threads of the process

Cols.Name: vsize_bytes
Cols.Desc: Virtual memory size in bytes of the process

Cols.Name: rss_bytes
Cols.Desc: Resident memory size in bytes of the process

Cols.Name: rchar_bytes
Cols.Desc: IO reads in bytes of the process

Cols.Name: wchar_bytes
Cols.Desc: IO writes in bytes of the process

Cols.Name: read_bytes
Cols.Desc: IO reads actually go to storage layer in bytes of the process

Cols.Name: write_bytes
Cols.Desc: IO writes actually go to storage layer in bytes of the process

Cols.Name: time_
Cols.Desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

Cols.Name: upid
Cols.Desc: An opaque numeric ID that globally identify a running process inside the cluster.

Cols.Desc: IP address of the remote endpoint.

Cols.Name: remote_port
Cols.Desc: Port of the remote endpoint.

Cols.Name: trace_role
Cols.Desc: The role (client-or-server) of the process that owns the connections.

Cols.Desc: Request opcode

Cols.Name: req_body
Cols.Desc: Request body

Cols.Desc: Response opcode

Cols.Name: resp_body
Cols.Desc: Request body

Cols.Desc: Request-response latency.

datatablesDocs.Name: network_stats
datatablesDocs.Desc: Network-layer RX/TX stats, grouped by pod. This table contains aggregate statistics measured at the network device interface. For connection-level information, including the remote endpoints with which a pod is communicating, see the Connection-Level Stats (conn_stats) table.

Cols.Name: time_
Cols.Desc: Timestamp when the data record was collected.

Cols.Name: pod_id
Cols.Desc: The ID of the pod

Cols.Name: rx_bytes
Cols.Desc: Received network traffic in bytes of the pod

Cols.Name: rx_packets
Cols.Desc: Number of received network packets of the pod

Cols.Name: rx_errors
Cols.Desc: Number of network receive errors of the pod

Cols.Name: rx_drops
Cols.Desc: Number of dropped network packets being received of the pod

Cols.Name: tx_bytes
Cols.Desc: Transmitted network traffic of the pod

Cols.Name: tx_packets
Cols.Desc: Number of transmitted network packets of the pod

Cols.Name: tx_errors
Cols.Desc: Number of network transmit errors of the pod

Cols.Name: tx_drops
Cols.Desc: Number of dropped network packets being transmitted of the pod
